game_margin_summary.note: The season shows a high-scoring environment with many lopsided results and relatively few razor-thin finishes.

major_themes: High variance week-to-week from many skill players (WRs and RBs), producing both huge single-game outperformance and large busts.
Kickers and D/STs have swung outcomes multiple times (several D/ST weeks 12+ and kickers 17+).
Bench management has been a recurring deciding factor: multiple managers left 20+ point performances on the bench in single weeks, often changing matchup outcomes.

playoff_teams_top_6.notes: Most wins and the highest Points For (avg ~130.4/week); currently on a 4-game winning streak (W3-W6).
Also 5-1; strong consistency and depth. 2-game winning streak (W5-W6).

playoff_teams_top_6.team: If Ur Not First You're Last
playoff_teams_top_6.notes: High-scoring weeks from Mahomes + dual-RB weeks; up-and-down weeks but holds a top record.
Receiver-driven scoring (Pickens) and strong defensive spikes; currently 2 wins in last 2 weeks.
Explosive individual WR/TE weeks (Amon-Ra, Goedert) and stable QB production; on a 2-game win streak.

Several huge single-game outputs (Ashton Jeanty, Cam Skattebo, multi-week QB/RB/WR upside). Selected as 6th seed based on being the highest-placed team remaining after head-to-head tiebreakers and Points For among 3-3 teams.

notes: Sixth seed required applying head-to-head / Points For among multiple 3-3 teams; Forte Inch Johnson holds a higher season Points For total among that cluster and wins head-to-head vs one of the tied teams.
Seeding is based strictly on the supplied records, head-to-head observations where available, then Points For totals computed from game results.

SnydeRemarks.scoring_pattern: Very high ceiling weeks driven by multiple offensive contributors (Lamar, McCaffrey, Emeka Egbuka) and occasional bench depth; one down result (Week2) but otherwise dominant.
SnydeRemarks.owner_behavior: Started aggressive pass-catchers and benefited from explosive WR/RB weeks; occasionally left large bench points (Romeo Doubs 29.8 benched Week4).

Kraft Montgomery Cheese.scoring_pattern: Balanced scoring across RBs and WRs with some big D/ST/kicker spikes (Saints D/ST Week5).
Kraft Montgomery Cheese.owner_behavior: Has shown good roster depth but also a pattern of leaving big bench outputs unused (Wan'Dale Robinson 28.2 benched Week2).

If Ur Not First You're Last.scoring_pattern: High-top-end weeks from Mahomes and strong RB performances (Jacobs, D'Andre Swift when active); some volatility from WRs.
If Ur Not First You're Last.owner_behavior: Has had good starts from premium assets; occasional bench construction (Tua benched Week5) limiting upside in specific matchups.

Kyler? I Barely Know Her.scoring_pattern: Receiver-fueled (George Pickens breakout weeks) and defense-driven swings (Lions D/ST Week4).
Kyler? I Barely Know Her.owner_behavior: Utilizes high-upside WRs; has sometimes left elite bench scoring unused (Bijan Robinson 35.8 bench Week5).

The Philly Special.scoring_pattern: Explosive individual WR/TE weeks (Amon-Ra, Dallas Goedert) and occasional kicker/bench defense contributions.
The Philly Special.owner_behavior: Has benefitted from big single-player games and left strong bench assets unused multiple times (Stefon Diggs and Dallas Goedert bench Week4).

Forte Inch Johnson.scoring_pattern: High upside with multiple big RB/QB/WR single-game outbursts (Ashton Jeanty, Cam Skattebo, Hollywood Brown); occasional underperformance from top QB (Josh Allen volatile).
Forte Inch Johnson.owner_behavior: Has shown strong depth but also a habit of benching productive players (Rico Dowdle, Justin Fields bench weeks) — still scoring highly overall.

Team Jon.current_streak: W5 preceded by L6 (last game L)
Team Jon.scoring_pattern: Week-to-week variance — enormous Week3 output, other weeks closer to mid-100s; defense/kicker spikes contributed in some wins.
Team Jon.owner_behavior: Repeatedly had Brock Purdy listed Inactive in early weeks and left Jared Goff on the bench (big Goff weeks unused), costing potential points.

Jake Butt Stuff.scoring_pattern: High ceiling via WR production in wins but severely impacted by multiple CeeDee Lamb inactives and intermittent QB/WR busts.
Jake Butt Stuff.owner_behavior: Multiple costly inactives/bench decisions involving CeeDee Lamb and bench QBs; has left significant scoring unused (Cam Ward, Chiefs D/ST in some weeks).

Trying to not finish last.scoring_pattern: High-RB outputs (Jonathan Taylor) and explosive WR weeks occasionally; tends to have a fluctuating floor.
Trying to not finish last.owner_behavior: Benched and inactive players have appeared at times; some weeks defense/kicking contributed unexpectedly large totals.

Dickhole Smashers.scoring_pattern: One-off big weeks driven by Kyren Williams and Baker Mayfield; otherwise below league average.
Dickhole Smashers.owner_behavior: BYE/inactive issues (Justin Jefferson BYE, Terry McLaurin inactive) and significant bench scoring left unused (Dalton Kincaid bench Week5).

Team Santangelo.scoring_pattern: High ceiling from Ja'Marr Chase and Sam LaPorta in several weeks but inconsistent RB/QB production and some bench misses (Jordan Love benched Week4).
Team Santangelo.owner_behavior: Has left high bench scoring unused (Jason Myers, Jordan Love) while relying on WR/Tight End explosions.

THE Derbaum.scoring_pattern: Often reliant on Javonte Williams / Derrick Henry or Deebo Samuel; results vary — included both big weeks and disappointing RB outings.
THE Derbaum.owner_behavior: Injuries/IR (Brandon Aiyuk) and occasional bench choices (Kimani Vidal scored big on bench Week6) have impacted weekly floors.

Big Trouble in Little Cameron.scoring_pattern: TE and WR spikes (Jake Ferguson, Nico Collins) have driven higher totals in some weeks; QB/DK benching has been impactful (Daniel Jones bench Week1).
Big Trouble in Little Cameron.owner_behavior: Left notable bench scores unused (Daniel Jones, Keenan Allen) in key losses; kicker volatility has hurt in a couple weeks (negative K weeks).

5WRsAllowedOnRostersNextYear.scoring_pattern: Puka Nacua has been a central positive, but QB/WR variance (Stafford, Jameson Williams) and a few bad D/ST showings produced inconsistency.
5WRsAllowedOnRostersNextYear.owner_behavior: Benched C.J. Stroud Week5 (28.76 on bench), an example of costly bench decisions occurring league-wide.

Hangin' With Mr. Cooper.scoring_pattern: Rookie QB/RB weeks (Drake Maye, Michael Penix Jr., De'Von Achane) have produced big spikes, but WRs have been inconsistent and D/ST has had negative results.
Hangin' With Mr. Cooper.owner_behavior: Repeatedly left high-scoring bench options unused (Calvin Ridley Week5, Kenneth Gainwell Week4).

Xavier Marks the Spot.scoring_pattern: Has had outlier big weeks (Mark Andrews + Vikings D/ST Week3) but also multiple weeks crippled by WR/TE busts or inactives.
Xavier Marks the Spot.owner_behavior: Numerous bench/inactive issues (Joe Burrow IR, Justice Hill benched with 28.7 Week4) have altered outcomes repeatedly.

consistent_top_producers.trend: Multiple 20+ point weeks (W1 23.6, W4 20.1, W5 31.3) — emerging repeat high-ceiling WR for his manager.
Consistently produced 20+ point games across several weeks (W1, W3, W5) providing a steady high floor.
Several big weeks (W1 23.1, W2 27.6, W4 36.0) but a sharp negative in W6 (4.8) — high upside but volatility visible.
Multiple 20+ outputs (W2 25.0, W5 26.9) including durable RB production; sometimes used as bench scoring by other managers.
Several high-output weeks (W1 29.36, W3 27.02) but some underperformances (W4 10.68) — high variance typical of rushing QBs.

repeat_underperformers_or_high_variance.trend: Notable inactivity/zero outputs (inactive Week4) and some games with large negative projection deltas; availability/health has been impactful for the manager.

teams_shown_on: If Ur Not First You're Last
repeat_underperformers_or_high_variance.trend: Huge outburst W2 (37.7) but multiple games well below projection (W4, W6) — boom/bust pattern.
Big early output (Week1) followed by sizable underperformance in Week6 (4.3), contributing to team volatility.
Extremely high bench scoring (35.8 in Week5) in at least one instance while being left inactive; high owner-side bench-management impact.

notable_single-week_spikes_used_or_bench.example: Romeo Doubs (SnydeRemarks) Week4 29.8 on bench — would have altered margin significantly if started.
Trevor Lawrence benched Week5 (26.24) for Xavier — repeated instances of high-scoring bench QBs across owners.
Rico Dowdle Week5 32.4 benched on Forte roster (W5) — large unused scoring.

league_wide_insights_and_highlights.scoring_environment: High-scoring across the league (avg ~108/team/week), but many matchups skew lopsided rather than tightly contested.
league_wide_insights_and_highlights.impact_of_kickers_and_destoppers: Kickers and D/STs have produced game-changing weeks (examples: Vikings D/ST 32, Saints D/ST 18, Eddy Pineiro 17, Ka'imi Fairbairn 18). Several matchups were decided or heavily influenced by these units.
league_wide_insights_and_highlights.bench_management_impact: Bench mismanagement is a recurring, measurable influence — managers across the league repeatedly left 20+ point weeks on the bench. Those decisions have altered outcomes in many close games.

notable_close_games: Team Santangelo 125.44 def. Big Trouble in Little Cameron 125.18 (0.26 points) — Week 5
Jake Butt Stuff 92.88 def. THE Derbaum 89.72 (3.16 points) — Week 2
If Ur Not First You're Last 145.78 def. Team Santangelo 142.78 (3.00 points) — Week 2
Xavier Marks the Spot 127.8 def. Team Jon 124.26 (3.54 points) — Week 4
The Philly Special 120.64 def. SnydeRemarks 119.2 (1.44 points) — Week 2
close_games_and_upsets.note: Although there are frequent blowouts, these narrow contests show playoff-style pressure can produce tight finishes when owners correctly align matchups and activate bench assets.

volatility_indicators: Multiple top pass-catchers and RBs produced 'zero' or single-digit outings in weeks where they were projected for double-digits (examples: CeeDee Lamb 0.0 Week3, A.J. Brown 2.7 Week4, Tee Higgins 2.5 Week3), leading to large projection deltas.
Several managers benefitted from defensive/kicking outliers — units that usually have low variance provided outsized returns in select matchups.

repeated_benching_of_high_scorers: Multiple owners left Trevor Lawrence, Bijan Robinson, C.J. Stroud, Romeo Doubs, Justin Fields, Rico Dowdle, and others on the bench in weeks where those players posted 20+ points. These decisions were explicitly referenced as matchup-changing in the weekly summaries.
Examples: Xavier owner benched Trevor Lawrence Week5 (26.24); Kyler owner benched Bijan Robinson Week5 (35.8); 5WRsAllowed owner benched C.J. Stroud Week5 (28.76).
inactives_and_roster_status_mismanagemen: Jake Butt Stuff repeatedly listed CeeDee Lamb inactive in multiple weeks — a consistent lost upside for that roster.
Team Jon repeatedly faced Brock Purdy inactives and left Jared Goff on the bench in weeks where Goff produced significant scores.
smart_or_high-leverage_starts: Managers who started D/ST or kickers that produced turnovers/TDs or long field goals gained outsized advantages (examples include starting Jaguars D/ST Week4, Saints D/ST Week5, and kickers with 17+ points).
Starting multi-dimensional QBs (rushing QBs) when they performed (Lamar, Josh Allen in select weeks) yielded strong returns for those owners.
risk_tolerance_examples: Some owners showed a preference for high-upside rosters with many boom-or-bust pass-catchers; this produced extreme weekly variance — either large wins or surprising losses when the boom didn't come.
Other owners fielded more balanced rosters with higher floors (consistent RB usage + stable QB play), enabling steady scoring and playoff positioning.

short_term_outlook_factors_to_watch.bench_management: Given the frequency of 20+ point bench outings, active weekly lineup management will remain a decisive factor in matchups.
short_term_outlook_factors_to_watch.D/ST_and_kickers: The next several weeks could again see matchups decided by D/ST/kicker spikes — managers who monitor matchups here may gain an edge.
short_term_outlook_factors_to_watch.player_volatility: Several high-impact players are showing boom/bust patterns (Puka Nacua, Malik Nabers, Garrett Wilson, Bijan Robinson benched spikes). Owners should expect continued game-to-game variance that will alter weekly playoff races.
short_term_outlook_factors_to_watch.playoff_race_notes: With two teams at 5-1 and three teams at 4-2, the final playoff spot is competitive among 3-3 teams; marginal lineup decisions and single-game outbursts over the next two weeks will be pivotal.
